title: Where to experience the '90s in Las Vegas
text: Where to experience the '90s in Las Vegas by Hilary Billings , Special for USA TODAY | Published on June 30, 2015 0 Our hearts will go on! Top-selling female artist Celine Dion returns to Caesars Palace in August. Catch her singing all of your favorite hits (and covers) as her music is brought to life with breathtaking visuals and a 31-musician orchestra and band. And yes, you may cry. Gerard Schachmes At Britney Spears' show, 'Piece of Me' at Planet Hollywood, the princess of pop will drive you crazy (in a good way) in with fantastical set pieces, hypnotic lighting and theatrics, and infectious dance numbers. Denise Truscello Spears’ chart-topping songs have been remixed to give the show a nightclub feel, ensuring you’ll be on your feet showing off your own dance moves. You may in fact leave the theater shouting, “Baby, one more time!” Denise Truscello It’s no fantasy — five-time Grammy winner Mariah Carey has set up shop at Caesars Palace with her first-ever Vegas residency. Denise Truscello Mariah Carey has more No. 1 records than Elvis and sings them all in her show (no, seriously). Prepare for an evening of constant sing-alongs, storytelling, reminiscing and dancing. Denise Truscello Fullscreen Here’s your one chance, Fancy, to see a Vegas country residency unlike any other. Multi-media entertainment mogul and country queen Reba McEntire joins the best-selling country music duo Brooks and Dunn for the first time ever at The Colosseum at Caesars Palace. Justin McIntosh You’ll be doing the boot scootin’ boogie to their biggest hits all night long at 'Reba, Brooks & Dunn: Together in Vegas.' Denise Truscello While Leonardo DiCaprio cannot be found among the relics, lovers of the 1997 movie will also love revisiting history in Titanic: The Artifact Exhibition, featuring 20 never-before-seen artifacts at Luxor. MGM Resorts International Visitors can learn about passengers’ stories, view their left behind treasures, admire The Big Piece — a massive 15 ton portion of the hull — and experience a replica promenade deck and iceberg. MGM Resorts International Each visitor receives a boarding pass from an actual passenger on the Titanic. At the end of the visit, you can find out if they survived by finding their name on the wall memorial. MGM Resorts International Fullscreen Suzanne Somers flourished in the ‘90s. Not only did the 'Three’s Company' star keep the nation hooked on the ThighMaster, she wrote numerous books, starred in the popular family show 'Step by Step' and co-hosted 'Candid Camera'. Now you can see her live as she entertains guests with comedy and song in 'SUZANNE Sizzles' at Westgate Las Vegas. Denise Truscello Grammy Award winners Boyz II Men bring '90s R&B back at The Mirage. Al Powers, PowersImagery.com Sing along to timeless songs like "I'll Make Love to You" with the best-selling R&B group of all time. Denise Truscello 'In Living Color' Fly Girl and 'Selena' star, Jennifer Lopez is debuting her show at Planet Hollywood early next year. We know it will feature a combination of ballads, funk and Latin music, and high-energy dancing in true J.Lo style. Michael Becker Who didn’t love launching themselves headfirst down a Slip ‘n Slide? Relive your favorite front lawn games at Vegas’ new Cowabunga Bay Water Park featuring one-of-a-kind water slides, a wave pool and an interactive children’s area. Cowabunga Bay Water Park Fullscreen Ever wondered how you’d fare in a G.I. Jane or Air Force One-type situation? Now’s your chance. Become a special operations assaulter for the day at Adventure Combat Ops. Participants embark on fully immersive and sensory-overwhelming missions with the finest non-lethal weapons and tactical gear. Appropriately called, “controlled chaos,” this is as real as it gets without enlisting. You better hope the time devoted to playing with Super Soakers growing up was well spent…because it’s game on.
